com.conichi.sdk.geofence

Interface CNIGeofenceManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CNIVenuesGeofenceManager

    public interface CNIGeofenceManager
    CNIGeofenceManager can have multiple instances. It will always access a single LocationService instance from Google API.

    Subscribe for update logic: 1. Will work until the process is killed or unsubscribe called 2. 'subscribe' call from difference CNIGeofenceManager instances will cause duplicate subscriptions related to the process to appear. 'unsubscribe' call is mandatory.

      • fetchAndAddGeofencesForLocation

        void fetchAndAddGeofencesForLocation(double latitude,
                                     double longitude)
        Fetches venues around the specified location and adds them as geofences
        Parameters:
        latitude - latitude of the location to fetch geofences around
        longitude - longitude of the location to fetch geofences around

      • removeGeofences

        Parameters:

      • removeAllGeofences

        void removeAllGeofences()
        Remove all geofences for all request codes

      • subscribeForLocationBasedGeofences

        void subscribeForLocationBasedGeofences()
        Subscribe to location changes to update geofences. Location updates will happen once per hour or when distance changes for mote than 5km

      • isSubscribedToLocationBasedGeofences

        boolean isSubscribedToLocationBasedGeofences()
        Returns:
        true if the sdk listens to location changes to update the geofence points

      • unsubscribeFromLocationBasedGeofences

        void unsubscribeFromLocationBasedGeofences()
        Unsubscribe from location changes. Geofences will not be fetched automatically.

      • fetchAndAddGeofencesForLastKnownLocation

        void fetchAndAddGeofencesForLastKnownLocation()
        Retrieves device last known location and adds geofences around it.

      • removeGeofences

        Remove list of specific geofences
        Parameters:
        geofenceIds - list of registered ids
